ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I had never painted before taking this class. Matt and Soren created an amazing environment to learn and be creative. We worked primarily in oil paint, but also experimented with water colors and acryllic.
I have taken my first foray into the world of painting, and have greatly improved my skills with oil and watercolor.

I learned so much from this class. I started with only a little painting experience and I ended with a lot more confidence in my art and my skill as a painter. I am so proud of the pieces I made and I am excited to keep painting in the future.
Oil painting
how to paint in a supportive, judgement free space
Painting critique! And basic skills in painting
I learned all about the process of oil painting: how to choose and prepare a surface to work on, how to mix paints and colors, and how to work on a painting over a period of time

This was a great setting to dive into painting! It was great to have some professional and peer feedback instead of just diving into it on your own. You also get to see others' techniques and things that help you figure out your own style.

Color theory, brush strokes, painting in watercolor and oil, how to have patience in painting with oil, and most importantly how to better look and understand art in the form of painting and all around us
I learned how to paint using oil paints, as well as things about composition, mixing colors, and many other things.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: structure of class helped you develop throughout the semester, the painting critiques were incredibly helpful, it was amazing to see everyone's progress throughout the semester, Matt and Soren are amazing!!

Weaknesses: it's definitely not a gut class, you have to spend a lot of time in the studio outside of class, but it was very fun going in outside of classtime
It is very good, maybe would be fun to do slightly higher number of smaller paintings, rather than a smaller number of more-involved projects.
This course was all strengths, definitely one of my favorite classes at Yale. The instructors were amazing and so knowledgeable and the assignments were all so different and compelling.

This course had a lot of strengths, such as the instructor and TA feedback, lots of supplies provided, and collaborative atmosphere. More basic techniques such as paint mixing and how to use the supplies given could be explained. I also did not enjoy the first monochrome collage assignment and wish we learned about painting human faces.
strengths: variety of assignments, level of support throughout the process, matt and soren

Great ta- Soren hope and professor! Good feedback and class dynamic 

Weaknesses- none
Due to time and ability contrainsts I don't think we got to talk enough about colors, perspective, and other basics that are not technically painting specific but would have been useful.

There's a weird paradox in the course where you get better grades for better paintings, but it's supposed to be a completely beginner's class, so I noticed some students who were absolutely completely beginners were sort of penalized as a result of this framework, which I didn't think was super fair. Just to be clear, I think the grading was largely in part based on effort, but I think expectations were a bit higher than what you might expect from a completely beginner's class, and part of this was probably because people who have painted before were in the class.
Strengths: Matt and Soren were both amazing! As a first time painter, they always helped me and I felt confident and comfortable  with them

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! must take
TAKE THIS CLASS! One of my favorite classes at Yale.
Yes, it was so much fun, and led to genuine improvement in my work.
I would definitely recommend this course, it was really fun to have a creative outlet amidst all the readings and papers of my other classes.
Yes, very fun course.
YES especially if youve never painted
Yes! Both Soren and Matthew were great teachers
Yes! This course requires time and effort, but it made oil painting, which I found scary, be fun and accessible even to non-art majors.
Absolutely, if you're interested in painting!
Yes yes yes!!! Take it before you graduate
